conversation.speaker: AI
conversation.text: So nice to meet you, Miguel! I'm Loora, your personal Al English tutor. Talk with me for just 5 minutes a day, and see how you become a confident English speaker! So tell me, where are you from?

conversation.speaker: student
conversation.text: Hello, Loora. Nice to meet you. My name is Miguel. I'm from Colombia, Latin America. It's a pleasure to meet you. Thank you.
conversation.loora_say_it_like_a_native: Hi Loora! I’m Miguel from Colombia. Really nice meeting you — thanks for having me!
conversation.loora_better_to_say: Hello, Loora. It's a pleasure to meet you. I'm Miguel, and I'm from Colombia, which is in South America. Thank you!

loora_grammar_corrections.explanation: Adds clarity with a full subject.

loora_grammar_corrections.correction: I'm from Colombia, in South America
loora_grammar_corrections.explanation: More specific and commonly used phrasing when talking about location.

sounds.feedback: Clear, but could be slightly smoother.
Try keeping this unstressed and short.

fragments.comment: Simple and polite greeting. Well used.

fragments.correction_1: I'm from Colombia, in South America.
fragments.correction_2: I'm from Colombia. It's in South America.
fragments.comment: 'South America' is more precise and common in spoken English.

fragments.success_sentence: It's a pleasure to meet you.

conversation.result_sentence_1: Hello, Loora. Nice to meet you. My name is Miguel. I'm from Colombia, in South America. It's a pleasure to meet you. Thank you.
conversation.result_sentence_2: Hello, Loora. It's nice to meet you. My name is Miguel. I'm from Colombia. It's in South America. Thank you!
conversation.say_it_like_a_native_speaker: Hey Loora! I’m Miguel from Colombia. Really glad to meet you — thanks for chatting!

conversation.speaker: AI
conversation.text: It's great to meet you! Colombia has such a rich culture and beautiful landscapes—what do you love most about living there?

conversation.speaker: student
conversation.text: Well, I was born here. I don't know other countries abroad, but I like everything, I think so.
conversation.loora_say_it_like_a_native: Well, I was born here. I don't know about other countries, but I like everything here, I believe.
conversation.loora_better_to_say: Well, I was born here. I don't know about other countries abroad, but I like everything, I think.

loora_grammar_corrections.original: I don't know other countries abroad
loora_grammar_corrections.correction: I don't know about other countries abroad
loora_grammar_corrections.explanation: The verb 'know' requires 'about' when referring to general knowledge of places or things.

loora_grammar_corrections.original: I like everything, I think so
loora_grammar_corrections.explanation: 'I think so' means agreement with someone else’s idea. 'I think' is used when expressing your own opinion.

sounds.feedback: Could be clearer, try softening it.

fragments.error_sentence: I don't know other countries abroad
fragments.correction_1: I don't know about other countries abroad
fragments.comment: Missing 'about' which is needed to express general knowledge.

fragments.error_sentence: I like everything, I think so
fragments.comment: 'I think so' sounds unnatural here. Use 'I think' to share your own thoughts.

conversation.result_sentence_1: Well, I was born here. I don't know about other countries abroad, but I like everything, I think.
conversation.result_sentence_2: Well, I was born here. I don't know about other countries, but I like everything here, I believe.
conversation.say_it_like_a_native_speaker: Honestly, I was born here and haven’t really seen other countries yet, but I like everything about living here!

conversation.speaker: AI
conversation.text: That's wonderful! It's great that you appreciate everything about your home. If you could visit any country someday, where would you like to go?

conversation.speaker: student
conversation.text: Well, definitely the US, Estados Unidos, because when I was a child, I see a lot of movies about, you know, Disney World, something like that, and I have a good image about them, and one day I want to travel there.
conversation.loora_say_it_like_a_native: Well, definitely the US, the United States, because when I was a child, I saw a lot of movies about, you know, Disney World, things like that, and I have a good image of it, and one day I want to travel there.
conversation.loora_better_to_say: Well, definitely the US, United States, because when I was a child, I saw a lot of movies about, you know, Disney World, something like that, and I have a good image of them, and one day I want to travel there.

loora_grammar_corrections.original: I see a lot of movies
loora_grammar_corrections.correction: I saw a lot of movies
loora_grammar_corrections.explanation: Past tense is needed to match 'when I was a child'.

loora_grammar_corrections.original: I have a good image about them
loora_grammar_corrections.correction: I have a good image of them
loora_grammar_corrections.explanation: The correct preposition is 'of', not 'about', when referring to impressions or mental pictures.
Use the English name in English conversations.

sounds.feedback: Try rounding the vowel slightly more.

fragments.comment: Great opener to state a choice. Very natural.

fragments.error_sentence: when I was a child, I see a lot of movies
fragments.correction_1: when I was a child, I saw a lot of movies
fragments.comment: Past tense is needed after 'when I was a child'.

fragments.success_sentence: you know, Disney World, something like that
fragments.comment: Casual and conversational, great fluency here.

fragments.error_sentence: I have a good image about them
fragments.correction_1: I have a good image of them
fragments.comment: Use 'of' when talking about mental images or impressions.

fragments.success_sentence: and one day I want to travel there
fragments.comment: Good structure and intention is clearly expressed.

conversation.result_sentence_1: Well, definitely the US, the United States, because when I was a child, I saw a lot of movies about Disney World, something like that, and I have a good image of them, and one day I want to travel there.
conversation.result_sentence_2: Well, definitely the United States. When I was a child, I saw lots of movies about Disney World and similar places. I have a great impression of it, and I'd love to go there someday.
conversation.say_it_like_a_native_speaker: Oh for sure, the US! I watched so many Disney movies as a kid — I’ve always dreamed of going there someday!

reading.title: What is AI?
reading.summary: Artificial intelligence refers to machines that can perform tasks requiring human intelligence.
reading.reflection_prompt: How do you think AI will change jobs in the future?

conversation.speaker: AI
conversation.text: What do you think about using AI in education?

conversation.speaker: student
conversation.text: It will help teachers and students a lot.
conversation.loora_say_it_like_a_native: I think it’s a great tool to support both teachers and students.
conversation.loora_better_to_say: It’s helpful for both teachers and students.

loora_grammar_corrections.explanation: 'Support' sounds more academic in this context.

fragments.success_sentence: It will help teachers and students.
fragments.comment: Grammatically fine, and the message is clear.
The verb 'help' is fine, but 'support' or 'assist' sounds more natural in academic discussions.

error_origin.explanation: You used a common verb, but a more formal one fits the tone better.

fragments.advice: Practice replacing general verbs like 'help' with more precise ones in different settings.

practice_zone.user_response_topic: I like painting and going to the beach.

conversation.speaker: AI
conversation.text: That sounds fun! What do you usually paint?

conversation.speaker: student
conversation.text: I paint landscapes and sometimes portraits.
conversation.loora_say_it_like_a_native: I mostly paint landscapes, but I also enjoy portraits now and then.
conversation.loora_better_to_say: I usually paint landscapes and sometimes do portraits.

loora_grammar_corrections.explanation: Adds frequency for more natural flow.

sounds.feedback: Final part too quick — slow down slightly

fragments.comment: Well-constructed sentence with correct tense and vocabulary.
Good addition that adds detail to your painting activity.
Adding an adverb like 'usually' or 'mostly' makes the sentence sound more natural in conversations.

error_origin.explanation: You forgot to include a time/frequency reference that makes it sound more fluent.

fragments.advice: Practice adding frequency adverbs like 'usually', 'often', or 'sometimes' to your daily activities.
